Digital engagement.Anchor Value: Name and identify the purpose of familiar digital devices (e.g. mobile phone, computer, tablet)
Send a short and simple reply to an email communication using a digital device
Recognise different ways to connect to the internet (e.g. Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, hotspot)
Build and maintain an effective online profile for career management
Use software on a portable device to document a building inspection by recording measurements, checking compliance and uploading photos
Write software for keeping track of items in an inventory

Use Enterprise Resource Planning software to monitor transactional data from multiple sources including accounting, procurement and human resources and visualise this data for a company's strategic plan
Set up a new computer system for a large multinational company
Develop new ways of guaranteeing the trustworthiness of transactions on decentralised, cloud based, distributed transactional systems

Initiative and innovation.Anchor Value: Ask for help when unsure what to do next
Support the adoption of new ideas that improve a work process
See how a window display is promoting sales and decide to create a similar display at the back of the store to sell another product
Continuously and systematically look for ways to improve your performance at work
Confer with co-workers to coordinate work activities
Find a more efficient way to produce end of month reports
Negotiate a price and sales terms then prepare a contract for a house
Collaborate with people from a range of backgrounds to prepare and deliver an original piece of work
Start a company that develops new technology

Learning.Anchor Value: Take a different route to work when a road is closed
Notice that a new flavour of ice-cream has been introduced and sell it to customers
Think about the implications of a newspaper article for job opportunities
Learn how to operate new machinery safely and efficiently
Learn a new filing system that groups documents by type, security classification, subject and date
Determine the impact of new menu changes on a restaurant's purchasing requirements
Effectively apply change management techniques while managing a diverse team
Develop and implement a new business strategy based on changing market conditions
Identify the implications of a new scientific theory for product design
Apply synthetic organic chemistry principles to design and synthesise functional liquid crystals for molecular electronics

Numeracy.Anchor Value: Identify the numerical position of items on a shelf from left to right
Check the weight and length of a product against a job ticket
Count the amount of change to be given to a customer
Use a blood pressure machine and accurately record the results
Create charts and graphs to accurately convey the results of a customer satisfaction survey
Calculate the square footage of a new home under construction based on plans using scales and ratios
Write a detailed report based on a comprehensive statistical analysis of the causes of workplace accidents
Prepare a report that summarises a business's current financial position and forecasts future earnings and income
Develop a mathematical model to simulate and resolve an engineering problem
Write a thesis on asymptotic properties of zero-sets of polynomials in differential equations

Oral communication.Anchor Value: Follow simple instructions like "wash your hands"
Provide a simple explanation to a supervisor about a work hazard
Cancel a newspaper delivery by phone
Give clear, sequenced instructions on how to use a hand-held drill
Answer a customer's questions about which product would work best for them
Give instructions to a lost driver
Participate in a work meeting and ask appropriate follow up questions
Explain a complex procedure or process to a client, taking into account linguistic needs and cultural sensitivities.
Explain advanced principles of genetics to a first-year university student
Provide meaningful, culturally appropriate support to someone in distress.

Planning and organising.Anchor Value: Attend work on time with appropriate clothing, tools and other resources as required
Organise a simple and repetitive work schedule
Schedule time for updating a manager on the progress of work
Use an organisational file sharing and storage system
Plan and organise your own activities as requirements change
Write a research report that presents recommendations after developing a project methodology, planning the research and developing a timeline

Develop a program of multiple live musical performances, special events and sports carnivals throughout the year at a sports club venue and coordinate volunteers, staff and contractors to deliver the events
Prioritise and plan multiple complex tasks several months ahead

Develop a dynamic plan for a complex, multi-faceted project, with timelines that include regularly reviewing priorities, interdependencies and performance during implementation, proactively identifying and managing project risks

Problem solving.Anchor Value: Respond to a red screen alert and turn a machine off
Approach a supervisor for advice before restarting a machine
Lay out tools to complete a job
Break a complex problem into manageable parts and follow a plan of action
Find evidence to support a history essay in a rare document
Redesign a floor layout to take advantage of new manufacturing techniques
Evaluate a construction project and recommend changes to comply with external standards and regulations
Examine records and data to investigate and prosecute corporate criminals
Develop and implement a plan to provide emergency relief for a major metropolitan area
Write a thesis on solar hydrogen generation from rust using 3Â­D nanostructured photoelectrodes

Reading.Anchor Value: Recognise simple labels on commonly used product items
Locate the time and place of a meeting on a weekly timetable
Read step-by-step instructions for completing a form
Read directions on how to operate a piece of machinery safely
Read and interpret instructions and technical drawings in an equipment instruction manual
Read a memo from management describing new personnel policies
Read a book on leading and managing change in a diverse and evolving workplace.
Read and analyse information comparing the impact of downturns in the global economy on the cost of producing and selling beef
Read a scientific journal article describing surgical procedures
Identify the key concepts and arguments from a range of highly academic sources in a specialised, new field of knowledge and synthesise information in order to progress research

Teamwork.Anchor Value: Put forward ideas in a meeting when asked to do so
Accept and act on guidance from a mentor
Cultivate a small informal network of people who may be able to advise on a project from a diverse range of perspectives.
Recognise and avoid inappropriate behaviours, such as use of discriminatory language, that undermine effective group interaction
Share knowledge, experience, information and resources with others as an integral part of work relationships
Engage with clients from a range of backgrounds and identify options to help them meet their needs
Work with a range of subject matter experts, with diverse perspectives, to achieve a challenging goal.
Perform an unscripted, live improvisation show with other actors

Writing.Anchor Value: Write name and address on a membership form, copying another document
Write everyday workplace specific vocabulary and abbreviations (e.g. product names)
Write a job history as part of a job application
Prepare a standard operating procedures document
Write a memo to staff outlining new directives
Write a legally binding contract for services provided by one business to another
Write a thesis on metaphor, syntax and grammar in nineteenth century novels
